page.title: 17ASHWELL CHURCH
page.content: Ashwell Church was built in the 14 century on an earlier pre-Domesday site.Its spire and tower is 53.5 m. high and you can see it for miles around.The church is 51m. by 70.5m. and is built from clunch.This is a soft local chalk. The clock faces on the tower were put there in 1896.There are only 3 faces!It is said this is because a local farmer did not want his labourers "clock-watching" from the fields.There are 6 bells in the tower. The church is famous for its {medieval {graffitti.}An inscription in the tower refers to the village being hit by plague during the{Black Death.}Another message dated 1361 tells of a great storm.There is also a drawing of the (pre-1666)Old St. Paul's Cathedral, London. Other graffitti in the soft walls are 20 Century names.
